de.hohenheim.view.mobile.animation

Class WalkToAnimator

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • de.hohenheim.view.mobile.animation.WalkToAnimator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Animator, java.lang.Runnable

    public class WalkToAnimator
extends java.util.Observable
implements java.lang.Runnable, Animator
    This class animates a AnimationFigure. The figure moves form its current position along a path to a specified room.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Arthur Kaul, Besim Gashi, Mathias Zwiesele, Daniel Intili, Bernd Hofs‰ﬂ

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      (package private) AnimationFigure animationFigure
      The figure to animate.
      (package private) NodeFigure end_node
      The room where the figure should go. this is a temporal position at a moment during the animation because along a path a figure can visit a lot of rooms.
      (package private) boolean finished
      indicates if the animation is finished.
      (package private) boolean init
      Indicates if animation started for the first time for one direct path.
      (package private) NodeMap map
      The NodeMap where the animation takes place.
      (package private) org.eclipse.draw2d.IFigure parent
      The parent of the animated figue.
      (package private) int run_count
      The run_count for each point inside a segment.
      (package private) int segment_nr
      The actual segment along the path which is animated in the moment.
      (package private) org.eclipse.draw2d.geometry.PointList segments
      We use a ManhattanConnectionRouter.
      (package private) NodeFigure start_node 
      (package private) boolean stop
      Indicates that a stopaction has started.
      (package private) boolean stopped
      Indicates if the animation is stopped.
      (package private) NodeFigure total_end
      This is the room where we really want to go.
      (package private) int trainSpeed
      the Speed of the Train as Value
      (package private) java.util.Iterator<NodeFigure> walking_path
      A list with all rooms where we want to go.

    • Field Detail

      • map

        NodeMap map
        The NodeMap where the animation takes place.

      • animationFigure

        AnimationFigure animationFigure
        The figure to animate.

      • start_node

        NodeFigure start_node

      • end_node

        NodeFigure end_node
        The room where the figure should go. this is a temporal position at a moment during the animation because along a path a figure can visit a lot of rooms.

      • total_end

        NodeFigure total_end
        This is the room where we really want to go. So the last room in this animation.

      • init

        boolean init
        Indicates if animation started for the first time for one direct path. This means: if the animation has more then one direct paths from one room to another then for each inner animation init must be set to true.

      • parent

        org.eclipse.draw2d.IFigure parent
        The parent of the animated figue. We need that to repaint the parent.

      • segments

        org.eclipse.draw2d.geometry.PointList segments
        We use a ManhattanConnectionRouter. So there can be rectangular branches along a path between two rooms. To animate the figure along this paths we separate all horizontal and vertical lines as segments to change direction (e.g. left then up).

      • run_count

        int run_count
        The run_count for each point inside a segment. So this can be from 0 to segment.size()

      • segment_nr

        int segment_nr
        The actual segment along the path which is animated in the moment.

      • stopped

        boolean stopped
        Indicates if the animation is stopped.

      • stop

        boolean stop
        Indicates that a stopaction has started. Problem is that we nust wait till it is really stopped!

      • walking_path

        java.util.Iterator<NodeFigure> walking_path
        A list with all rooms where we want to go.

      • finished

        boolean finished
        indicates if the animation is finished.

      • trainSpeed

        int trainSpeed
        the Speed of the Train as Value

      • WalkToAnimator

        public WalkToAnimator(NodeMap map,
              AnimationFigure figure,
              NodeFigure end_node)
        Constructor. creates the Animation.
        Parameters:
        {@link - NodeMap} map - The NodeMap where the animation takes place.
        {@link - AnimationFigure} figure - the figure we want to animate itself.
        {@link - NodeFigure} end_node - The node where we want to go to.

    • Method Detail

      • getPathTo

        private PathFigure getPathTo(NodeFigure end_node)
        Helper method to get a path from the figures (AnimationFigure) current position to the specified node.
        Parameters:
        {@link - NodeFigure} end_node - The node we want to have a direct path to.
        Returns:
        PathFigure.
        Throws:
        PathNotFoundException - if no path can be found.

        public boolean isStopped()
        Indicates if the current animation is stopped succesfully.
        Specified by:
        isStopped in interface Animator
        Returns:

      • run

        public void run()
        runs the animation and restarts itself as long as the animation is not finished. After it is finished the observer listening for the finished event is notified. Don't use this method to start the animation!
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • getValueSpeed

        private int getValueSpeed(int pathSpeed)

      • getMaxDrivingSpeed

        private int getMaxDrivingSpeed(int pathSpeed,
                     int trainSpeed2)

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts the animation. Can also be used to restart the animation if it was stopped. To start(run) the animation only use this method!
        Specified by:
        start in interface Animator

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops the animation. The animation can be restarted with @see start()
        Specified by:
        stop in interface Animator
